ST, ALBANS The National Cathedral School for Boys
MOUNT ST. ALBAN, WASHINGTON 16, D.C.
Canon CHARLES MARTIN, Headmaster
Mr, Robert Underwood, Jr,,
NAEB Network Manager,
14 Gregory Hall,
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Mr, Undervrood,
8, 1958
I am enclosing a "Network Program Submission Form” given me by
Mr, Jack Summerfield of VIGBH-FM in Boston, I talked with Mr,
Summerfield this last week in Boston regarding broadcast by
WGBH of a program held here at St, Albans on March 23 entitled
"Science and Secondary Education,” of vrhich I am enclosing a
printed transcript.
We have both edited and unedited versions of this program, I left
an unedited tape with Mr, Summerfield which VGBH duplicated for
an edited broadcast on May lyth at 4:00 PM,
At that time he told me of the NAEB and the method of submitting
programs for possible distribution by the netv/ork. He offered to
edit the tape down to 59 minutes and also provide openers and
closers for it, and also to handle anything else regarding the
tape as required by NAEB, Unfortunately, we do not have such
facilities readily available here.
This program, or symposium, was the first of a series of such
symposia exploring the problems of secondary education to run
through June 1959. St, Albans, by virtue of its location and
strong support in the nation's capitol. is particularly able to
hold such programs with ease. This particular program created
a great deal of interest, obtaining national news coverage as
well as mention in LIFE, TIME, and NEWSWEEK, ¥e feel the tapes
are especially" suited for educational radio stations.
Since Mr, Summerfield did not have many submission forms, he
could give me only one. If you would send me a supply of them^
I would be glad to provide you with the required number. Also,
please inform me if there is anything else I must do in order to
insure expeditious audition procedures and, I hope, network
acceptance, I am forwarding a copy of this letter xo Mr. Summerfield
